SEARCH
Package jpacman.model

Class Move

java.lang.Object
jpacman.model.Move
Direct Known Subclasses:
PlayerMove
public abstract class Move extends Object
A potential move from one cell to another. The responsibilities of this class include indicating the effect of the move (player dies, player wins, ...), whether the move is possible, and actually carrying out the move.

This class actually implements the Command design pattern from Gamma et al: The apply() method takes the role of the execution, and ensures that the move is actually done. The way the effects are handled is the responsibility of the clients of this class.

Version:
$Id: Move.java,v 1.8 2008/02/04 10:11:19 arie Exp $
Author:
Arie van Deursen, created August 2003.

  • Constructor Details

    • Move

      public Move(MovingGuest fromGuest, Cell toCell)
      Create a move from a MovingGuest to a particular Cell. Precondition: the moving guest occupies a cell. The target cell can be null, in which case the move simply won't be possible.
      Parameters:
      fromGuest - The guest to be moved
      toCell - The target location

  • Method Details

    • moveInvariant

      public boolean moveInvariant()
      Check that the guest to be moved indeed occupies a cell. Furthermore, moves that cause the player to die are not possible.
      Returns:
      True iff the mover occupies a cell.

    • precomputeEffects

      protected void precomputeEffects()
      Compute all possible effects of this move, such as the potential death of the player and whether the move is possible at all. Precondition: not called before. Postcondition: initialization completed.

    • tryMoveToGuest

      protected abstract boolean tryMoveToGuest(Guest targetGuest)
      Try to move to an occupied cell. Precondition: targetGuest != null and still initializing (see tryMoveToGuestPrecondition).

      This method implements a double dispatch: the actual behavior depends on both the subclass of the source and the target guest.

      Parameters:
      targetGuest - Guest the mover will meet
      Returns:
      true iff the move is possible.

    • tryMoveToGuestPrecondition

      protected boolean tryMoveToGuestPrecondition(Guest targetGuest)
      Boolean function representing the precondition of tryMoveToGuest(Guest targetGuest).
      Parameters:
      targetGuest - The guest this mover is going tomeet.
      Returns:
      true iff the precondition of tryMoveToGuest() holds.

    • initialized

      public boolean initialized()
      Check if the method has been initialized via the precomputeEffects method.
      Returns:
      true iff precomputeEffects has been called.

    • playerDies

      public boolean playerDies()
      Return true iff the player will die because of this move. Precondition: class has been initialized.
      Returns:
      true iff player won't survive this move.

    • movePossible

      public boolean movePossible()
      Return true iff the move is possible. Precondition: class has been initialized.
      Returns:
      true iff the guest can make this move.

    • apply

      protected void apply()
      Actually carry out the move. precondition: the move is possible. postcondition: the old cell is empty, the target cell is occupied by the mover.

    • die

      protected void die()
      Invoke this method while precomputing the effects of this move if it is detected that the player will die because of this move. Precondition: initialization not yet completed.

    • getMovingGuest

      protected MovingGuest getMovingGuest()
      Obtain the guest initiating the move.
      Returns:
      The mover.
